abstracts.cdata!:
The Energy Project in Guinea-Bissau
            project partially achieved its objectives particularly due
            to the corrective measures after its restructuring. The
            major factors that affected implementation of the project
            were as follows: Non-materialization of co financing, (ii)
            High inflation, which accelerated from 15 percent to 57
            percent increased osts, and affected Electricidade e Aguas
            da Guinea-Bissau (EAGB) assets, which became undervalued,
            (iii) Distribuidora de Combustiveis e Lubrificantes (DICOL)
            complex legal and institutional situation. The development
            objective of the project was to increase the sector's
            efficiency. To that end, the outcome of the project is fully
            satisfactory for the petroleum and institutional
            strengthening components and marginally satisfactory for the
            power component. The experience gained in the execution of
            the project was useful for the design and preparation of the
            proposed Water and Energy Project. This follow-up project
            should help in deepening reforms in the sector, allowing
            further private participation, strengthening institutional
            capacity and sustaining operations and maintenance of the
            country's infrastructure for the energy sector.
